Chaofeng Ye Associate Professor Graduated School: Michigan State University, USA Tel: 021-20685366 Office: Room 1D-301E, SIST Building E-mail: yechf@shanghaitech.edu.cn Homepage: http://psit.sist.shanghaitech.edu.cn/ Research Area: Affiliation: Research Group: Research Area: Precision sensing, non-destructive testing, weak magnetic measurement, signal processing æèä¸»é¡µï¼ Profile Teammate Research Educate Service achievements Papers Videos Related Main Responsibilities(A) Minor Responsibilities(B) Minor Responsibilities(C) Chaofeng  Ye received the Ph.D. degree in electrical  engineering from Michigan State University, East Lansing, MI, USA. His main research areas include: R&D and application of magnetic sensors (atomic magnetometer, quantum effect magnetoresistive sensor, fluxgate sensor), electromagnetic nondestructive testing, weak magnetic measurement, intelligent signal/image processing, etc.. He has published more than 50 papers, authorized 2 US patents and 5 Chinese patents.He teaches the undergraduate course Circuit Principle and the graduate course Electromagnetic Sensing and Testing.
